newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean won ends flat after falling on strong dlr.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean won ends flat after falling on strong dlr.

text.p: The won ended unchanged in Friday's session after recovering from a sudden fall as dealers bought up dollars in the afternoon on a weakened yen, traders said.
They also said a weakened offshore won in the non-delivery forward market in Hong Kong and Singapore encouraged dollar-buying sentiment in Seoul.
The won finished unchanged at 888.10. It hit a morning high of 887.70 and dropped to 888.40 when the yen fell to 114 from its morning trading rate of 113.
But the won strengthened before Friday's closing ahead of month-end export negotiations expected to boost dollar supply.
A dealer at Korea First Bank said the won would trade between 887 and 889 next week and hover mostly near the 888.60/70 level with incoming foreign funds for equity investments.
